data.title: The 50 smartest private high schools in the US
data.meta_description: These schools offer the best academic programs in the country.
data.text:
This story is available exclusively to Business Insider subscribers. Become an Insider and start reading now. Have an account? .

Beautiful campuses and strong athletics are important, but for the best schools, it always comes down to the academics.

Advertisement

Our friends at Niche, a database of information about schools, created a list of the smartest private high schools in America.

Niche determined the bulk of the rankings by weighing each school's composite SAT/ACT score, the average score of the colleges attended by graduates, and the percentage of graduates who go on to attend a four-year college. You can read more about Niche's methodology here.

This story is available exclusively to Business Insider subscribers. Become an Insider and start reading now. Have an account? .

Here are the top 50 schools, presented with their composite SAT range, which refers to the range of SAT scores that correspond with the school's composite ACT score.

Advertisement

50. Cistercian Preparatory School — Irving, Texas

Composite SAT range: 2140-2210

At the all-boys Cistercian Preparatory School, many classes are led by monks, and the curriculum weaves together both academic and religious teachings. Students took 25 different Advanced Placement classes last year, and 93% earned a 3 or higher on the corresponding exams.

Advertisement

49. Choate Rosemary Hall — Wallingford Town, Connecticut

Composite SAT range: 2020-2070

Not only does Choate offer an impressive amount of Advanced Placement options — 27 — but 81% of students score either a 4 or 5 on the exams. Students can also participate in one of Choate's Signature Programs, which immerses the student in an area they're particularly interested in, such as the environment or Arabic and Middle Eastern studies.

Advertisement

48. The Kinkaid School — Houston, Texas

Composite SAT range: 2080-2130

The beginning of January consists of "interim term," a three-week period in which students have opportunities to travel internationally, complete internships, and take courses in subjects not typically offered. In both classes and extracurriculars, Kinkaid operates via four core values: honesty, responsibility, respect, and kindness.

Advertisement

47. Hackley School — Tarrytown, New York

Composite SAT range: 2020-2070

Hackley School students take on a rigorous curriculum during their Upper School years, but can customize it to fit their individual interests and academic needs so that no two students' schedules are the same. Students who choose to take the ACT score an average of 30 out of 36.

Advertisement

46. The Latin School of Chicago — Chicago, Illinois

Composite SAT range:2020-2070

Located in the heart of Chicago's Lincoln Park neighborhood, Latin School of Chicago combines stringent academic standards with a focus on experiential learning. Within this curriculum, students gain multiple perspectives on each subject through role playing, labs, and field trips. Outside of the classroom, they can choose from over 50 extracurricular activities, ranging from cooking club to Model UN to gospel choir.

Advertisement

45. The Armand Hammer United World College — Pecos Township, New Mexico

Composite SAT range: 1980-2010

At the Armand Hammer United World College, students can earn an International Baccalaureate Diploma, a prestigious degree recognized worldwide. To complete the degree, students take college-level courses in six subjects, write an extended 4,000 word essay, and work on community service projects.

Advertisement

44. Emma Willard School — Troy, New York

Composite SAT range: 2020-2070

Students at the all-girls Emma Willard School can receive academic credit for class work at area colleges, career internships, community service, and individual athletic competitions as part of the school's practicum program. In addition to its academic offerings, Emma students also participate in 12 interscholastic sports and a host of art classes, ranging from photography to orchestra.

Advertisement

43. Ransom Everglades School — Miami, Florida

Composite SAT range: 2080-2130

In the class of 2014, Ransom Everglades School counted 18 National Merit finalists and 19 National Merit semifinalists. Post-grad, 100% of students enroll in four-year universities, and last year, students went on to top schools including Brown, Stanford, and the University of Chicago.

Advertisement

42. Buckingham Browne & Nichols School — Cambridge, Massachusetts

Composite SAT range: 2020-2070

With small class sizes — typically around 11 students — and a selection of over 20 advanced and honors classes, Buckingham Browne & Nichols School strives to create an ideal environment to challenge students. BB&N is also part of the Global Online Academy, which allows students to take additional courses online from partner schools all over the world.

Advertisement

41. The Thacher School — Ojai, California

Composite SAT range: 2020-2070

Located on a former ranch in California, The Thacher School provides plenty of opportunities for students to get outside, including horseback riding and weekend camping trips. Academics still remain front and center, however, with students taking up to five AP classes at a time.

Advertisement

40. Regis High School — New York City, New York

Composite SAT range: 2140-2210

The only private, all-scholarship school in the US, tuition is free for Regis students — if they can get in. The all-boys school abides by a competitive admissions process and accepts only incoming freshman, no transfers. During their time at Regis, students receive individualized college counseling and a top-notch education.

Advertisement

39. The Branson School — Ross, California

Composite SAT range: 2080-2130

During the summer before their senior year, students at The Branson School can apply for one of five academic fellowships, which provide opportunities to travel and enroll in esteemed programs around the world. All seniors also complete a capstone project to showcase both their personal interests and intellectual skills.

Advertisement

38. Groton School — Groton, Massachusetts

Composite SAT range: 2080-2130

Groton students can take up to six courses per semester — higher than the average four or five at other schools — with choices ranging from studio art to archaeology to computer science. The school also has a 94% success rate for students scoring 3 or higher on AP exams.

Advertisement

37. Belmont Hill School — Belmont Massachusetts

Composite SAT range: 2080-2130

At the all-boys Belmont Hill School, 94% of students receive a 3 or higher on their AP exams, and a commendable 55% of students earn a perfect 5. Post-grad, every single student matriculates to a four-year university, with many attending top schools such as Washington University in St. Louis and MIT.

Advertisement

36. Maret School — Washington, DC

Composite SAT range: 2020-2070

Originally founded as a French school in 1911, Maret students learn several languages, starting with Spanish in kindergarten, French and Latin in sixth grade, and Chinese in ninth grade. Maret also prides itself on innovation in academics, and incorporates technology and hands-on projects into all of its classrooms.

Advertisement

35. The Roxbury Latin School — Boston, Massachusetts

Composite SAT range: 2140-2210

A remarkable 100% of graduates from The Roxbury Latin School attend college, and at some of the best schools in the country to boot. Last year, 33% of grads matriculated into Ivy League schools, with others attending top colleges such as Duke and Northwestern.

Advertisement

34. Sidwell Friends School — Washington, DC

Composite SAT range: 2020-2070

As a Quaker school, Sidwell Friends School strives to foster a community of respect and truth in addition to strong academics. Within this framework, students focus on environmental sustainability, critical thinking skills, and community awareness.

Advertisement

33. Brunswick School — Greenwich, Connecticut

Composite SAT range:2020-2070

The all-boys Brunswick School offers 28 Advanced Placement classes, as well as an extensive language program where students can study Arabic, Mandarin, French, Italian, Latin, or Spanish. Through a longstanding partnership with nearby Greenwich Academy, Brunswick students can take classes on either campus.

Advertisement

32. Menlo School — Atherton, California

Composite SAT range: 2080-2130

Through a rigorous curriculum and program that includes advanced classes, STEM workshops, community service, and online course options, Menlo thoroughly prepares students for college. And it shows: In the last three years, Menlo graduates have gone on to top schools, including Johns Hopkins, MIT, and Princeton.

Advertisement

31. Noble & Greenough School — Dedham, Massachusetts

Composite SAT range: 2080-2130

In addition to their required classes, students at Noble & Greenough School can undertake independent study projects in any subject they choose, as approved by their advisor, allowing students to explore all areas that interest them. Emphasizing the value of well-rounded students, Nobles's afternoon program focuses on arts, athletics, and community service.

Advertisement

30. Cranbrook Schools — Bloomfield Hills, Michigan

Composite SAT range: 2020-2070

At Cranbrook, college preparation is a major priority — students start talking about it freshman year and begin working one-on-one with a college counselor during their junior year. In addition to exceptional academics, Cranbrook students also have access to two on-campus museums: the Cranbrook Academy of Art and Museum and the Cranbrook Institute of Science.

Advertisement

29. Hopkins School — New Haven, Connecticut

Composite SAT range: 2080-2130

The third oldest independent school in the country, Hopkins's curriculum aims to introduce students to a wide breadth of subjects with over 150 course options, including 43 AP and honors courses. Ninety-five percent of students take at least one AP course per year, and 94% earn at least a 3 or higher on the corresponding exams.

Advertisement

28. Sage Ridge School — Reno, Nevada

Composite SAT range: 2080-2130

Though a relatively new school, founded in 1998, Sage Ridge students excel academically, with 94% of students earning a 3 or higher on their AP exams. Since 2011, graduates have attended several elite colleges, including Carnegie Mellon, Dartmouth, and the United States Naval Academy.

Advertisement

27. Middlesex School — West Concord, Massachusetts

Composite SAT range: 2080-2130

With a 4:1 student to teacher ratio and 23 Advanced Placement courses offered, students at Middlesex receive the knowledge and support they need for college admissions and beyond. In fact, nearly 16% of Middlesex graduates attended Ivy League schools over the past five years.

Advertisement

26. Milton Academy — Milton, Massachusetts

Composite SAT range: 2080-2130

At Milton Academy, having fun and learning are not mutually exclusive — students can sign up for a wide variety of electives, such as "Human Sexuality & Relationships" and "Architecture and Engineering 2-D." The school also boasts an impressive list of alumni, including poet T.S. Eliot and former US Senator Robert F. Kennedy.

Advertisement

25. Rye Country Day School — Rye, New York

Composite SAT range: 2080-2130

Students at Rye Country Day School are encouraged to pursue whatever interests them, both inside the classroom and out. The school offers a wide selection of extracurriculars, from dance to drama to athletics, and invites students to immerse themselves in as many different activities and subjects as they choose.

Advertisement

24. St. Paul's School — Concord, New Hampshire

Composite SAT range: 1980-2010

Students at St. Paul's can choose from over 50 advanced or AP classes across numerous disciplines, including chemistry, Japanese, and art. They go on to highly-esteemed colleges as well — Georgetown, Brown, and Columbia topped the list of the most popular colleges for graduates over the last four years.

Advertisement

23. Marlborough School — Los Angeles, California

Composite SAT range: 2080-2130

With small class sizes — around 13 students — and a host of specialized classes, including topics in sports medicine and the culture of food, girls at California's Marlborough School receive an outstanding education. The school also sponsors a speaker series, with former Secretary of State Madeleine Albright and Pulitzer Prize-winning New York Times columnist Nicholas Kristof as past lecturers.

Advertisement

22. Lakeside School — Seattle, Washington

Composite SAT range: 2080-2130

Although Lakeside doesn't offer any official Advanced Placement classes, over 200 students still chose to take AP exams, scoring at least a 3 or higher on 98% of them. Outside of their studies, students can also join a variety of clubs, with options ranging from women in STEM to meditation.

Advertisement

21. The Hockaday School — Dallas, Texas

Composite SAT range: 2080-2130

The Hockaday School offers over 18 Advanced Placement classes, and last year, an impressive 96% of students received a score of 3 or higher on their AP exams. The all-girls school also counted 21 National Merit finalists and 22 National Merit semifinalists among the class of 2014.

Advertisement

20. Polytechnic School — Pasadena, California

Composite SAT range: 2080-2130

Polytechnic School, affectionately known as Poly, offers an array of learning experiences, both in and out of the classroom. Starting freshman year, Poly students participate in community service and outreach projects, and can choose from a number of outdoor trips, including mountain biking in Mammoth and rock climbing in the Sequoia National Forest.

Advertisement

19. Phillips Exeter Academy — Exeter, New Hampshire

Composite SAT range: 2080-2130

Phillips Exeter Academy offers small class sizes — typically around 12 students — and hundreds of courses across a variety of subjects, including anthropology and computer science. The school invented the Harkness method, where students lead class discussions and actively engage instead of listening to lectures, which is now used in schools across the globe.

Advertisement

18. Collegiate School — New York City, New York

Composite SAT range: 2140-2210

Located on Manhattan's Upper West Side, the all-male Collegiate School focuses on providing students with a comprehensive liberal arts education. While students follow a strict curriculum of mandated classes through ninth and tenth grade, they are free to choose from a number of electives by senior year, including "European Modernism" and "Biotechnology."

Advertisement

17. National Cathedral School — Washington, DC

Composite SAT range: 2080-2130

Students at National Cathedral School can also take classes at St. Albans School, another top private school in D.C., through the schools' coordinate program. In the last five years, students from NCS have matriculated to top colleges, including Harvard, Northwestern, and New York University.

Advertisement

16. The Hotchkiss School — Lakeville, Connecticut

Composite SAT range: 2080-2130

Within the framework of their curriculum, Hotchkiss students receive sizeable latitude to choose a variety of classes and pursue what interests them. And with over 240 courses offered, including 22 Advanced Placement options, there's plenty of room for individualization.

Advertisement

15. The Westminster Schools — Atlanta, Georgia

Composite SAT range: 2080-2130

Over the last five years, 84 students — about 9% of Westminster grads — have gone on to Ivy League colleges. Students also enjoy cutting edge facilities, including 14 state-of-the-art laboratories, a digital music lab, and a 10-lane competition pool.

Advertisement

14. Collegiate School — Passaic, New Jersey

Composite SAT range: 2080-2130

New Jersey's Collegiate School limits class sizes to only 15 students in order to create a safe, welcoming environment for students to learn. The school strives to stimulate creative and critical thinking, and prepare students for both college and life after.

Advertisement

13. St. John's School — Houston, Texas

Composite SAT range: 2081-2130

Students are encouraged to challenge themselves — both personally and academically — at St. John's School, and can take advanced classes such as multivariable calculus, organic chemistry, and ancient Greek. Last year, a commendable 83% of students scored either a 4 or 5 on their AP exams.

Advertisement

12. The College Preparatory School — Oakland, California

Composite SAT range: 2140-2210

One hundred percent of College Prep students who took AP tests scored 3 or higher on every exam and 55% of students in the class of 2015 received National Merit recognitions. In addition to their AP classes, students also participate in "intraterm" in the spring, a week where they take one intensive week-long class in place of their usual studies.

Advertisement

11. Winsor School — Boston, Massachusetts

Composite SAT range: 2140-2210

Winsor's urban location in Boston puts it close to several useful resources, including the Boston public library, Museum of Fine Arts, and Harvard Medical School. Though academics remain Winsor's main focus, the all-girls school also builds time for extracurriculars into each student's weekly schedule. Students can choose to participate in anything from community service to drama and engineering clubs.

Advertisement

10. Dalton School — New York City, New York

Composite SAT range: 2080-2130

The Dalton plan, developed in 1922, remains the foundation for learning at the Dalton School today. Each student follows three pillars — house, assignment, and lab — which create a specialized learning environment and ensures individual attention. The school also offers several co-curricular opportunities, including peer mentoring and student government.

Advertisement

9. Lawrenceville School — Lawrenceville, New Jersey

Composite SAT range: 2080-2130

Lawrenceville offers a whopping 154 advanced or AP courses, including everything from "Creative Nonfiction" to "Statistical Reasoning In Sports" to "Atmosphere and Ocean Dynamics." In class, students learn using the Harkness method, in which individual desks are replaced with a community table and the students lead the class discussion.

Advertisement

8. St. Mark's School of Texas — Dallas, Texas

Composite SAT range: 2140-2210

In addition to high SAT scores, students at all-boys St. Mark's School of Texas earn an impressive average of 33 out of 36 on the ACT as well. The school's challenging curriculum prepares students for first-class colleges, with Duke University, the University of Pennsylvania, and the University of Texas at Austin among the most popular.

Advertisement

7. Trinity School — New York City, New York

Composite SAT range: 2140-2210

In additional to their core classes in English, history, math, and science, Trinity students take courses in foreign language, religion, and performing or visual arts, with options such as "Latin Prose" and "Understanding Gotham" to chose from. In 2010, Forbes named the NYC school the No. 1 prep school in the country.

Advertisement

6. Stanford Online High School — Stanford, California

Composite SAT range: 2140-2210

Though completely online, creating a community and fostering relationships are two of the main priorities at Stanford's Online High School. Founded as a three-year high school in 2006, the school has since expanded to include grades 7-12, with full-time, part-time, and single class enrollment opportunities. Students experience the challenge and flexibility of college courses, with the expertise of Stanford instructors, most of whom work full-time for the school.

Advertisement

5. Horace Mann School — New York City, New York

Composite SAT range: 2140-2210

Named the best private high school in New York, Horace Mann School offers 20 Advanced Placement classes and six foreign languages. The school is comprised of four campuses across New York City and Connecticut, and continues to build and open new facilities to provide students with the most up-to-date resources.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Advertisement

2. The Harker School — San Jose, California

Composite SAT range: 2140-2210

Students at The Harker School can choose between more than 26 official Advanced Placement classes, as well over 20 post-AP classes if they wish to go even deeper into a subject. This hard work pays off too — the class of 2015 includes 59 National Merit semifinalists and 62 National Merit commended students.

Advertisement

1. Castilleja School — Palo Alto, California

Composite SAT range: 2140-2210

An impressive 100% of students at all-girls Castilleja School are admitted to top-choice colleges. No surprise considering the rigorous coursework Casti students undertake, with classes including human physiology, mathematical modeling, and modern European literature.

Advertisement
